pros: You can learn a lot, especially if you keep your heart as open as your mind.
cons: It isn’t easy work. It takes a lot of patience and a lot of love.

job_title: Therapist,  Academy Staff Member in Gilbert, AZ
pros: -Great location and facility -A rewarding population of kids and young adults to work with -Paid time off earned after working with the company for 3+ years
cons: -Unbalanced members of top management with little to no accountability due to the familial or otherwise personal relationships amongst them. -CEO is often disrespectful and unkind when presented with concerns or criticism, despite expressing an "open door policy" style of management. -A toxic and outdated "we are all a family" workplace attitude. The considering of employees as "family" is management's free pass to mistreat, belittle, and overwork staff. -A lack of clear advancement opportunities, with promotions given based more on favoritism and percieved loyalty. -Near constant staffing turmoil, exasturbated by the emphasis on continuing to grow the Academy program. -Controversial Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) principles dressed up in corporate buzzwords, with little room for other viewpoints to help guide the decisions that affect students, their education, and their overall wellbeing.

pros: LIFE is a heart-centered non-profit that puts people first ALWAYS. Everything is about the kids, and if it’s not about the kids, it’s about the employees, and if it’s not about them then it’s about the community. It’s all about the people. It was a beautiful environment to work in and one I’m glad I got to experience.
cons: This isn’t a good fit for anyone who only thinks logically or wants to approach problems with their head and not their heart.

pros: I’ve already learned so much since I started here. I think I had all these ideas about what it would be like to work with kids with autism, and being here for the past year has just blown all of that out of the water. I’m so grateful for this experience and everything it’s teaching me about what I want to devote my life to.
cons: I haven’t experienced anything negative as of yet.

pros: The people who run things are genuine, good people who are always trying to do what they think is right.
cons: Unfortunately, good intentions don’t always lead to good ends. But we roll with the punches and keep trying.

pros: I have nothing but respect for Margaret. That woman is a force to be reckoned with and I can only hope I’m half the woman she is when I get to be her age.
cons: I moved out of state. Otherwise, I’d still be there.

pros: I loved everything about my time at Lauren’s. It was an incredible experience. I grew as a person in so many ways. And it’s an experience I know I’ll take with me into every moment of the rest of my life.
cons: The work itself isn’t easy. You need a lot of patience and a good heart.

pros: LIFE is one of the good ones! I’ve been here two years and haven’t had a single issue yet, and I’m not one of those people who’s afraid to speak up if something’s off either.
cons: If there were any I’d be the first to say something.

pros: Good people Good pay Good mission Good work
cons: Good work always takes an emotional toll

pros: Highly, highly recommend. Lauren’s is a solid company to work for. They treat their employees will and give you everything you need to succeed in your role.
cons: Not very many cons, just a few mishaps here and there but nothing serious.

review_title: Love my kids and everyone here
pros: Love, love, love my kids. Love my coworkers and my manager. Just have nothing but love for everyone here.
cons: You won’t make a fortune working as an RBT.

pros: Hands down some of the most amazing kids in the state!
cons: Loved the work we did, but needed to focus on my own family.

pros: I’m just so incredibly happy to be here!
cons: I haven’t noticed anything so far.

pros: Well-run professional organization Pay is commensurate for the industry Time outside of work is respected
cons: Managers can be overbearing at times

pros: *Pays well and offers full benefits *Friendly coworkers *Managers aren’t overbearing *Sweet kids *All tools and resources provided
cons: *Having to deal with BS from parents

pros: Every moment here was one of the best of my career!
cons: I was sad to leave but I chose to move to be with my partner.

pros: Everything has been really good so far.
cons: Can’t say I have any complaints yet!

pros: Great staff and work environment
cons: There was a high staff turnover rate

pros: This has been a great place to work and the environment is very child-oriented.
cons: There has been a shortage of staff

job_title: Registered Behavior Technician in Gilbert, AZ
pros: Flexibility, Training, Breaks, Communication, Growth oppportunities within
cons: If you are undertrained, some clients can be overwhelming, don't be afraid to speak up and ask for help.

review_title: Best school ever to work at!!
pros: Very supportive, high standards, open to new ideas, a great place to work
cons: I don't have a con.

job_title: Academy Staff Member in Gilbert, AZ
pros:
-Competitive pay (this doesn't mean good pay, just that it's about the same as other places)
-You will learn a lot (mostly from the basic need to survive and not from healthy learning experiences.
cons:
-Lauren's Institute is the most uniquely toxic place of work I have ever experienced. 
-Administration is unqualified, uninterested, and all related to each other so that they need not face any consequences. Ever. 
-Most staff are related to someone in administration, romantically intertwined with someone in administration, or have been best friends since the dawn of time with someone in, you guessed it, administration. 
-If you happen to be related to someone that works here, you need not have any qualifications, as you will likely be a teacher within the next couple weeks. 
-Worry not if there is no need for any new administrators, if and only if you "know the right people" a fake title will soon be made up for you as an excuse to pay you more than any entry level employee could dream of making. 
-Professionalism doesn't exist at Lauren's Institute. Inter-staff drama, bullying, or other sorts are seemingly encouraged or at best, ignored. 
-Pertinent information regarding your work will be kept secret from you for no reason other than to make your job more difficult and maybe to add a little "spice" to your day. 
-Communication is nonexistent and will quickly become the bane of your existence should you choose to work here. 
-Should you run into any myriad of issues and feel that you should bring it to the attention of leadership or management, they will gladly lie to your face to get you out of their office and proceed to do not a single thing to change. 
-If you are anything like me, then you will wake up every day dreading going to work, praying that the day goes by quickly, and looking forward to the day you never have to return. 
-Parents are kept in the dark about what is going on with their child's education and the environment in which they are learning. 
-Your heart will surely break, because anyone that decides to work in special education knows that these children are special and deserve the world and yet it is them that suffer when Lauren's Institute is incapable to keep employed anyone worth having. 
-This place is a huge waste of potential. There is such a need for a facility like this and yet they continue to fail both families and staff alike.

pros:
1. Team Work - The teamwork with all of the teachers is AMAZING! They have 3 tracks, Behavioral, Functional, and Academic! This helps in the roads that parents choose for their students!!! 
2. Management! Margaret has a heart of gold!!!! 14k GOLD! She loves all the staff and is such a kind hearted person! She has a smile on her face even when the days are tough! She is a super hero! Justin the CFO is so knowledgeable. I had a situation arise that he was able to walk me through every step and made me feel so comfortable! It’s amazing to have this organization on your side! All of the Directors work so hard in their departments to ensure LIFE goes round! 
3. My co-workers! It feels so good to be apart of a world that everyone wants to be in! When I walk through the gates in the morning I know that I get to work with a team that has the same love for these kiddos that I do!!!
cons: More Team building Activities!!! I know we one at Thanksgiving, but we need more! :)

review_title: Their heart  is in he right place however they lack direction.
pros: LIFE has wonderful, caring staff with their hearts in the right place to serve the student population. They are all working towards one common goal, student success!
cons: LIFE has a Confusing management hierarchy as well as, lack of communication between staff and management which creates a parent relationship and not a professional relationship between upper management and other staff, which is concerning. There is a strong propensity towards favoritism among faculty.

pros: The kids...I love being part of a child's journey of learning.  There are some great staff on campus that work towards the same goals I have.
cons: I think we might have grown to fast.  The atmosphere has changed a little.  There are people on campus that I don't know and never see.  There are staff here that are inadequate at there jobs with nothing being done about it.  Staff need to be trained and after that training if they still continue to fall short of their job then they should be let go.   I think the structure of pay needs to be looked at.  The level of work needs to be comparable to the level of pay.  I make less than some staff with a much higher work load.

pros: This academy has an amazing opportunity for personal and professional growth which is promoted by all staff. There are a variety of departments to work in on this campus including specialty therapy, behavioral programming support, and within the academy. The individuals in senior leadership positions are beyond willing to help each individual that walks on campus reach their goals even if it means providing supervision, transferring employee to a different department, or just with their education in general. The feeling of family and life truly radiates when you walk through this campus.
cons: Although management and senior leaders are on campus it proves difficult to get in contact/ sit down and meet with them even time to time. This truly is a client based business and if you're not assertive in getting your questions answered it will be difficult for you to grow here.

pros: All therapies are on campus including specialty therapist OT, SLP, PT, Behavioral support, adult program and academy are within one area. So many activities on site; social interactions, splash pad, large and small playgrounds. Management is on site and able to help in ways they are able. Very take initiative company that if you have a question to ask.
cons: Occasional times when client cancels that there is no opportunity for staff to work during that time and may be placed somewhere making less.
